we can tell you that someone a body was

the the family are believed to be
Libyans originally neighbors talked
about them having Libyan flags flying in

and they lived at more than one address

they've lived it more than one address
here in Manchester so they knew the city
very very well but the police believe

including an eight-year-old girl and
several other teenagers and Daniel then
what are the implications of that fact
that as you say the suspected suicide
bomber here was born in the United
Kingdom born in Manchester well in some
ways we've become used to that it's not
the first time that we've had British
suicide bombers and it's not the first
time we've had British suicide bombers
we've chosen to target the UK so there
aren't major implications I think the
Libyan connection is interesting because
of course there was a strong involvement
of British jihadis from Manchester in
Libya at the time that Colonel Gaddafi
was deposed from power in Libya so I
think that it's quite interesting but I
think critically at the moment what the
police still really need to do is to try
and work out where that improvised
explosive device was made and by doing
that finding out who made it and that
will tell them whether Salman Abady was
a man who sat alone built a device and
took it to that concert last night
always working as part of a wider

who are plotting this devastating attack
